TITLE: Installing dependencies using uv in Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to install the project dependencies using the uv package manager for Python. It includes steps for installing uv, cloning the repository, and installing the project dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/mcp-mem0/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install uv

git clone https://github.com/coleam00/mcp-mem0.git
cd mcp-mem0

uv pip install -e .

cp .env.example .env
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building and running Docker container for MCP-Mem0
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to build a Docker image for the MCP-Mem0 project and run it as a container. It includes commands for building the image with a specified port and running the container with environment variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/mcp-mem0/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker build -t mcp/mem0 --build-arg PORT=8050 .

docker run --env-file .env -p:8050:8050 mcp/mem0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running MCP-Mem0 server using uv
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to run the MCP-Mem0 server using the uv package manager. It includes commands for both SSE and Stdio transport modes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/mcp-mem0/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Set TRANSPORT=sse in .env then:
uv run src/main.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring MCP client for Python with Stdio transport
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet shows how to configure an MCP client to use the MCP-Mem0 server with Stdio transport in Python. It includes the command, arguments, and environment variables needed for the configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/mcp-mem0/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "mem0": {
      "command": "your/path/to/mcp-mem0/.venv/Scripts/python.exe",
      "args": ["your/path/to/mcp-mem0/src/main.py"],
      "env": {
        "TRANSPORT": "stdio",
        "LLM_PROVIDER": "openai",
        "LLM_BASE_URL": "https://api.openai.com/v1",
        "LLM_API_KEY": "YOUR-API-KEY",
        "LLM_CHOICE": "gpt-4o-mini",
        "EMBEDDING_MODEL_CHOICE": "text-embedding-3-small",
        "DATABASE_URL": "YOUR-DATABASE-URL"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring MCP client for Docker with Stdio transport
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet demonstrates how to configure an MCP client to use the MCP-Mem0 server with Stdio transport in a Docker container. It includes the Docker command, arguments, and environment variables needed for the configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/mcp-mem0/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "mem0": {
      "command": "docker",
      "args": ["run", "--rm", "-i", 
               "-e", "TRANSPORT", 
               "-e", "LLM_PROVIDER", 
               "-e", "LLM_BASE_URL", 
               "-e", "LLM_API_KEY", 
               "-e", "LLM_CHOICE", 
               "-e", "EMBEDDING_MODEL_CHOICE", 
               "-e", "DATABASE_URL", 
               "mcp/mem0"],
      "env": {
        "TRANSPORT": "stdio",
        "LLM_PROVIDER": "openai",
        "LLM_BASE_URL": "https://api.openai.com/v1",
        "LLM_API_KEY": "YOUR-API-KEY",
        "LLM_CHOICE": "gpt-4o-mini",
        "EMBEDDING_MODEL_CHOICE": "text-embedding-3-small",
        "DATABASE_URL": "YOUR-DATABASE-URL"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring MCP client for SSE transport
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet demonstrates how to configure an MCP client to connect to the MCP-Mem0 server using SSE transport. It includes the necessary configuration for the mcpServers object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/coleam00/mcp-mem0/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "mem0": {
      "transport": "sse",
      "url": "http://localhost:8050/sse"
    }
  }
}
```
